channel.title: Atapi's Homepage!
channel.description: Atapi's blog posts and site updates! Be subject to my ramblings!'

item.title: New RSS Feed!
item.description: hiiii!!! new site update! i figure i'd try out this RSS thing!

item.title: Adventures in Rock Band on Linux
item.description: I detail the rediscovery of my love for Rock Band over here!

item.title: Enabling MIDI Support for Legacy WINE Gaming
item.description: Hiii! I figured I should write this little guide on getting MIDI emulation up and running with WINE, it's a confusing process for sure!

item.title: The State of Linux Gaming (as of January 2025)
item.description: Here's my maybe-not-so-comprehensive deep dive into everything that is right and wrong with Linux gaming as of Januaray 2025.

item.title: 2024 Year in Review, I Guess
item.description: I make fun of stupid things that happened throughout 2024.

item.title: On Gender
item.description: I asked some friends and some netizens on the Fediverse to give me descriptions of how they see themselves, here's some musings on that.

item.title: Personal Observations from the Gigaleaks
item.description: After a month of work, I had sifted through the complete collection of the 2020-2021 Nintendo Gigaleaks and here's a long list of everything that catches my eye.

item.title: Music I Think is Rad and Stuff
item.description: In this blog post I tried to justify my apparently really mid-tier music taste.

item.title: Those Weird Numbers from the Sky
item.description: Over here, I infodump about various historical numbers stations, used by undercover military operatives primarily during the first Cold War.

item.title: The Theory Behind This Site
item.description: A sort of manifesto, if you will, about why I previously designed the site the way that I did. Needs an addendum.

item.title: Welcome to my Homepage!
item.description: A short essay about why I think the personal web is so special!

item.title: Tales from the Computery Nonsense Folder
item.description: A growing collection of stories and information about my past when it comes to touching computers.

item.title: Emulating the Gigatron TTL in MAME
item.description: One user in the r/emulation Discord asked me to write this post when I first finished my MAME Gigatron driver back in August of 2020. Here's that blog post! :3
